project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When trying to build GreenHopper 6.0.8 from source, we get some strange behavior. This also applies to later versions:

# Assuming the [Atlassian SDK|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System] has been set up correctly...
# Get GH 6.0.8 code from my.atlassian.com
# Run an atlas-run command: You get 7 missing dependencies as it is impossible for find jars for 6.0.8.1-SNAPSHOT.
# Rename the project to 6.0.8 in the pom.xml. Do that for the parent pom also. You now get most of the dependencies except:
#* com.atlassian.studio:studio-common-components-plugin:jar:1.6.6
#* com.atlassian.studio:studio-theme-core:jar:1.6.6

Can we please have this checked? Apart from the mention of 6.0.8.1-SNAPSHOT that we should take care of, is it that we need to make these jars available in the public repo or rebundle our code accordingly?

Furthermore, in my.atlassian.com we see very big differences when it comes to source size:
* GreenHopper 6.0.1 is 52.8 MB
* GreenHopper 6.0.2 is 5.0 MB

Is this normal?

h3. Workaround

 Raise a ticket at our Support System - https://support.atlassian.com , so that support may provide you with the missing dependencies.
fields.summary: Building GreenHopper from source is missing dependencies

fields.description:
We create a lot of stories and subdivide each story into tasks. Estimates are made on the tasks.

Because of this, all stories appear to be unestimated, even though we have much better estimates when you take the aggregate of the subtasks.

Should GH be taking this into account?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6754].
  {panel}

From docens of requests and comments concerning Rapid Board deficiencies on this web site - and from various discussions with other JIRA stakeholders and other customers, I know that this is a very serious issue.

The Rapid Board has moved out of labs way to early for many customers.

This request is meant to gather the MUST HAVE requirements that would make us customers wanting to move to the Rapid Board.

Dear Atlassian, please see this request as a chance to make Rapid Board a really big success. This request is an offer to give our best support to achieve that common goal.

Thank you.
fields.summary: As an Atlassian (enterprise) customer I request that Rapid Board fulfills some MUST HAVE requirements

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As the RapidBoard is still so immature for our big organization we cannot start using it.

In order do not confuse our 2,000 users - and for a later migration - we need this little config switch on system level. confusing users means wasting time and money!

PLEASE DO NOT CLOSE THIS REQUEST (as you did for others before)

Please be fair and give other customers the chance to vote on this request as well.

Thank you.
fields.summary: As a JIRA system admin I want to decide, if my users see GreenHopper Classic, RapidBoard or both in the JIRA UI

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello.

Since I miss the impediment flag functionality in the classic boards I thought of something. I know that it has been suggester to use card colours to highlight impediments, but there are two problems with this. First, colourblind have trouble with card colours, obviously, but secondly, colours are not combinable, but icons are.

I use card colouring to highlight many things, but I must consider the order of the colours.

But by being able to add icons, based on JQL, to the cards in all views would be very useful indeed. Of course it could become quite messy and cluttered if not used wisely, but that should be the decision of the administrators anyway.

Anyone who thinks this is a good Idea but me?
fields.summary: Feature Request: As a Greenhopper user, I'd like be able to add icons to the cards via JQL

fields.description:
See screenshot.

# Load a board for a specific project
# Click "Create Epic" button
# Choose another project
# Create Epic

You see a success message "Your epic ... has been created". It should instead be "Your epic ... has been created but is not currently visible" or whatever the exact message is when you do the same thing for issues.

This problem is particularly nasty when you are viewing a board of a project you do not have Create Issue permission for -- the current project will never be chosen and hence all epics created will always be invisible but you will never know.

fields.description:
While in Scrum-"Plan"-mode, pressing '.' and entering "Scre" opens the screenshot window on an marked issue.

Clicking on the "Cancel"-button in the screenshot-windows results in an 404 error, because the Subdir "jira" is cut off from the URL.

Steps to replicate:

1. Open Scrum-Plan-Mode
2. Mark an issue
3. Press .
4. Enter 'Scree' and choose Screenshot
5. Press "Cancel" in the popup-window

Now a 404 error occurs.

The HTML-Sourcecode of the screenshot window shows a line 

var returnUrl = "/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=planning&selectedIssue=ALM-107&epics=visible";

but this has to be

var returnUrl = "/jira/secure/RapidBoard........
fields.summary: Adding a screenshot in "Plan"-Mode results in 404-Error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 
GreenHopper appears to over-rank issues as described in the below steps. This could be avoided resulting in a potential better usage of GreenHopper

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
Look at the attached screenshots.
* Board 1 containing the all issues in the below order
** PRJ-1
** PRJ-2
** PRJ-3
** PRJ-4
** PRJ-5
* Board 2 containing
** PRJ-1
** PRJ-4
** PRJ-5
* When PRJ-5 is prioritized above PRJ-4, it sits all the way above below PRJ-1.

(i) Pictures speak better than words, the attached screenshots explains this better.

h3. Expected Results:
* The expectation is that PRJ-5, sits just above PRJ-4 and below PRJ-3
fields.summary: As a User, the 'over' ranking done by GreenHopper should be avoided

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

When starting a new sprint, attempting to use the date picker does not display the calendar pop up and the dates cannot be changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new board.
# Add an issue to the sprint in the backlog.
# Start the sprint.
# Attempt to change the date.

h3. Expected Results:

The calendar appears and the date can be selected.

h3. Actual Results:

The calendar does not appear and dates cannot be entered.

h3. Regression:

Untested in earlier versions.

h3. Notes:

This was tested and works in 5.10.6. It may have been fixed in 5.10.5.2, however was not tested in that version.
fields.summary: Start Sprint date picker dialog does not work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Classic task board easily fits twice as many cards.

And with the extra spacing the Rapid Board is still a lot harder to distinguish cards. The exploded UI offers little benefit.

Different teams/boards will likely desire a different degree of compactness.

Suggestions for a more compact UI:
 - customisable font, the rapid board's font is unnecessarily larger than classic boards and there seems no way to change this,
 - customisable card height, for example specified in number of text lines, required height would often be configured proportional to number of columns,
 - remove days in progress dots, not wanted and waste of screen for some teams
 - configure issue links to go to normal jira issue page, completely disabling the greenhopper issue details view,
 - configure individual columns to hide sub-tasks, for example sub-tasks in the "To Do" column may need not be visible and therefore save a lot of screen UI.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user i would like a compact UI displaying as many cards as the classic board can

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: To increase the overview on an agile board in work view with many sub-tasks we configured it to show stories as swimlanes. Unfortunately we can't see the status of stories without opening it. Would it be possible to show the status as some kind of a box placed in the headline bar of the lane. By moving this box to a different column the status of the story would change just like sub-tasks.
fields.summary: As a GH User I want to see the status of a story and directly change it if it is shown as a swimlane

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a lot of sub-tasks which affect the overview in the work view of the agile board. It would be nice to be able to collapse stories and hide all related sub-tasks in all columns to improve the overview and accellerate the work within the daily scrum meeting.
fields.summary: As a GH User I want to collapse stories and hide all sub-tasks to have a better overview in the working board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
With the ability to mark epics as Done, it is now possible that users will see an Epic Name lozenge in the Backlog and not be able to see the epic in the panel that this name refers to.

The lozenge on the Issue Detail View should contain a link to the epic's Epic Report.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to find out more information about an issue's epic when the epic is "Done"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Rosie,

In 6.1 we will have the ability to mark epics as "done" -- see GHS-6372.

Out of the box, there is no way to re-open an epic. However this can be achieved by following these steps:

# Add the *Epic Status* field to the View and Edit screen of your project
# View the epic in JIRA
# Edit the issue and choose Epic Status as *Open*

Could you please make sure this is documented for the 6.1 release?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Please document how to re-open an epic once it has been marked as Done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 
Deletion of a filter that is associated with a Rapidboard causes the Rapidboard to disappear from the Agile menu as well as the Manage boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a rapid board
# Delete the filter associated with the board from JIRA
# The board disappears from the Agile Menu and Manage Boards page.

h3. Expected Results:
# The board should be still be present in Manage boards and when GH detects that it is not having the associated filter, it should request the owner of the board to re-associate it with a filter or with project(s)

h3. Actual Results:
# The board disappears from the Agile Menu and Manage Boards page.

h3. Regression:
NA

h3. Notes:
At the same time the board related data is still available in the database.

h3. Workaround
{panel:title=Workaround}
Refer the article - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Boards+Are+Not+Visible+After+the+Filter+is+Deleted
{panel}
fields.summary: Deletion of the Filter Associated with a Board Removes the Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6705]. {panel} This is difficult to reproduce - needs tampering with the post data for the page. On Classic Board, go to the search box. Tamper with the posted data and add the parameter redirectURL with something like: redirectType=xxx"> (Note: it doesn't work if you use tags) You need to have > 1 page of search results - more than 30 by default, or change the Issues Per Page in the Tools > User Preferences section. The image is rendered within the page numbers.
fields.summary: XSS in redirectType parameter on SearchBoard.jspa

fields.summary: Greenhopper Menu Not Rendering, Shows Error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great to have individual burndown charts on GreenHopper.

*Feedback* from a customer,

{quote}
Is there such a function in Jira as an individual burndown chart? Jira support asked that I give feedback to GH support since there is no individual burndown chart. There is much value in an individual burndown chart for the dev team and for the product team as well. It would give me a better gage of how much projected work per sprint is being accomplished per person and would allow me to make adjustments accordingly. Also many of the devs have been inquiring of seeing their own burndown chart to see how they are resolving tasks per sprint and what is not getting resolved when applicable. It looks like this was a past feature from reading in support forums but not one available with the new boards?

Is there an alternate way to allow devs to view their progress each sprint that is not manual?

Thanks
{quote}
fields.summary: Individual burndown charts needed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Scenario:*

# An issue in an active sprint of project X is cloned
# The clone is moved to project Y
# The active sprint of project X cannot be closed, because I do not have admin rights for project Y

*Cause:*

It seems the issue is retaining its 'sprint' information, so the active sprint then applies to both project X and project Y. To close the sprint, therefore, the user must either gain admin rights to project Y, or remove the cloned issue from the sprint (in project Y, where no such sprint previously existed).

*Workaround:*

Open the agile board for project Y (or create one if none exists), and you should see a new sprint, named after the active sprint in project X. In this sprint you will find the cloned issue; select the issue and in its preview window, select option "remove from sprint". Do this for all issues cloned from project X; then you can close the active sprint in project X.

*Suggested Solutions:*

# Issues be stripped of their sprint information, when they are cloned (see [GHS-5098]); or if that is not possible...
# Issues be stripped of their sprint information, when they are moved from one project to another
fields.summary: Issues retain their sprint information, when moved to another project

As of now, the *Card Styles* is [implemented|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+your+Card+Styles] globally to all user(s) as far as *GreenHopper* is concerned.
fields.summary: Permission to specify which Card Style can be viewed by certain user(s) / group(s)

The other one which seems interesting is updateIssueSelectionState. It looks like it may be doing O(number of issues in backlog) operations. Can we avoid this? I think we're doing something silly in here.
fields.summary: Investigate updateIssueSelectionState, updateDetailViewSize

fields.description:
Edit an issue in the backlog and change the issue type to Epic, then submit.

The epics panel is reloaded showing the new epic, the backlog remains as before thus still shows the issue and the detail view remains in its old state too (still showing the epic label for example)
fields.summary: Issue not removed from backlog when type changed to an epic

In a tabless design, these shortcuts would be to scroll up and down within the details view without using the mouse.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to cycle through details view information using the keyboard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have built up a hierachy of issues types "Feature", "User Story" and "Story Task" - with custom coding for automatic issue links, status synchronization, custom field inheritance, effort accumulation and reporting. 2,000 users worldwide.

The feature "Simplified Workflows" (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+GreenHopper+Simplified+Workflow) would break our complete process rules and reporting infrastructure. therefore we need to be sure, that GreenHopper remains fully functional and consistent without "Simplified Workflows".

The UI must not have any references to "Simplified Workflows" in this case.
fields.summary: As a JIRA system admin I want to decide, if the GreenHopper UI supports "Simplified Workflows" or not

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the board config for a Kanban board, you should be able to declare that this board does not create releases -- which would suppress the create release link.

The release functionality is dangerous for projects which manage releases using scrum boards and other tasks using kanban boards.
fields.summary: As a Kanban board administrator, I would like to be able to suppress the release link.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6675].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The Reports generated by JIRA Software/JIRA Agile do not allow for the sorting of issues and appear in a random order. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to sort the issues by various fields common to the issues that are displayed in the report.
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround is possible on the report, however one can use the "View in Issue Navigator" and use JQL queries to sort the issues accordingly. 

h3. Original Requst
Would like the option to sort charts on the Rapid Bord by column type.
fields.summary: Sort options for Rapid Board chart data tables

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to clear issues in the done column is by releasing a version.

An administrator should be able to configure the board to have more than one "Clearing" criteria (applied on top of board filter) and a corresponding "Clearing Action".  

Options could be:
 - Release a version (the current functionality)
 - Close all resolved issues
 - (not sure if there are others, but I could see that being the case)

This is important for issues and queues which do not involve software releases, but may exist in a project where releases do happen.  

For example I have tasks (issue-types such as task, technical task, etc) which are managed as a process queue in kanban.  

In the same project, I have release items (issue-types such as Story, Improvement, Feature, Bug) which are managed as a software release process in scrum.  I differentiate between the two using the board filters on issue-type since these may be in the same project.  

Under current functionality, a release from the kanban board will create a release and interfere with the scrum (real releases) process.
fields.summary: As a Kanban user, I'd like to be able to clear items from the board without releasing a version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Kanban configuration:swimlanes allows "stories (subtasks)" option when subtasks is disabled in jira
fields.summary: Kanban configuration:swimlanes allows "stories (subtasks)" option when subtasks is disabled in jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Task with subtasks later converted to Story/Epic does not show subtask count or actual subtasks on Kanban board although it does appear under subtasks on the task info column that appears on the right after the Done column (highlighted in green on attached screen shot)
fields.summary: Task with subtasks later converted to Story/Epic does not show subtask

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great to have a feature to rank sub-tasks in the Rapid Boards in GreenHopper. One such use case for this would be, in some occasions, the parent issue is not shown on the board but its sub-tasks are shown.

Due to this, the sub-task could not be ranked as it is still bounded to the "hidden" parent issue.

This can be shown in the attached video.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper User, it would be Good to be Able to Rank Sub-Tasks in Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For agile boards, there exists a report mode. In this report mode I can see my open and my last finished sprint report. However, this is not enough.

As a product manager I need to be able to access and see more sprint reports, i.e. all for my current release. 

It would be nice if I could configure how many old reports I'd like to see there or how many sprints back or how many sprints back based on a date/time difference from today in the past.

I then want to see those old sprint reports in the combobox, select and display them.
fields.summary: Save more sprint reports for retrospective

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a story is on the Greenhopper board, and you select Edit from the quickview cog on the right, then change it to an Epic, the board will not be refreshed and they new epic will not show on the left column.

A refresh will show the new Epic on the left column.

Demonstration: http://screencast.com/t/rY9aKsw37
fields.summary: When changing a story to an epic in Plan mode, the board does not refresh.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
With the introduction of inline editing of many text fields for JIRA 5.1,
I would like to see this in more places.

E.g. in the Plan mode of a Scrum board, I can enter comments by pressing the Comment button. But this results in a modal popup. I would prefer to use inline editing here.
fields.summary: As a scrum board user, I would like to be able to edit the comments inline in the detailed view of Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When enabling the Epic support for Scrum Board, we will get a panel listing all of the Epic associated to the board. And with this, we can drag and drop issues listed in Backlog to Epics as needed. 

However, if all issues mapped to the Epic is already completed, and the Epic itself is closed in JIRA, apparently the Epic will still listed in the board. And furthermore, we are still able to drag and drop issues to a closed Epic. 

Sample screenshot illustrating the behavior:
!scshot1.png!

!scshot2.png!

This may cause some confusion when using the Scrum board, hence it will be great if Closed Epics are removed from the Scrum board.
fields.summary: Epics will remain in Scrum Board although when the issue is already closed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Rename any existing instances of the field to Epic Name
- Rename the type of the field to Epic Name
- Ignore any change items that were previously created against this field
- Search for any references to "Epic Label" and replace them with "Epic Name" -- including documentation (cc: [~rosie@atlassian.com])

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if there is a duplicate named field?
A: (x) This could cause unexpected results but [~miruflin] states we can't do much about this. Deemed unlikely and an extreme edge case.

Q: What if there is a field type for this already in the system?
A: (x) This could cause unexpected results but [~miruflin] states we can't do much about this. Deemed unlikely and an extreme edge case.

Q: What about existing quick filters or swimlanes (any JQL) that reference the field name?
A: (x) JQL will become invalid, same as any JQL made on a field where the name is changed. Swimlanes/QF would be using Epic Link though since the parent's value is not available.
fields.summary: Change Epic Label field to Epic Name

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For active sprints, upcoming sprints and the backlog we currently we only show a message inside the container when its contents are affected by a filter and no issues remain.
The filter can be one or more of Instant Filter, Quick Filter(s), Epic Filter.
For the sprints there are counts showing visible issues e.g. 3/11 Visible Issues, but not for the backlog.

To help users realise there are filters affecting the contents of each container and assist with the removal of any filtering we will add an icon to any filtered container. The title attribute (tooltip) will contain a message in the format "32 Issues filtered. Click to clear all filters."
Clicking the icon will reset all filters on the board including all Quick Filters, Epic Filters and the Instant Filter. If the Instant Filter was active then its contents would be removed as it is reset.

*Stretch* Additionally while we are making the issue count available to the backlog container  we will show the current issue count on the backlog header.

See linked EAC page for sketch.

---

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens when you apply instant filters? Is the field cleared as well?
A: (x) Needs to clear value

Q: What happens if you have issues selected?
A: (x) Should not change selection

Q: What happens to any open dropdowns when this button is clicked?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Do these buttons only clear filters for 1 sprint, or all? If not all, how would we display which filters are active for which sprints?
A: (x) Needs to be for all

Q: What if Epic filters are on but the panel is closed?
A: (x) Needs to clear epic filter
fields.summary: Put 'Filtered' icon at top of backlog and in each sprint header, clicking it clears all filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ability to convert Agile boards between Scrum and Kanban types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Customer engagement improvements

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Append additional information via Give GreenHopper Feedback to Description field
- Make 'what do you like?' and 'what needs to be improved?' optional 
- Capture the board type (Scrum, Kanban) in the background
- Expand the optional information that we collect on the Give GreenHopper Feedback link to include:
* Role (dropdown)
** ScrumMaster
** Product Owner / Manager
** Developer
** QA
** Project Manager
** Other
- pre-populate the name and email address

This will give us a better idea of who is raising feedback and enable us to track features against roles.
fields.summary: As a PMM I would like to know more about our second users

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Using original hours remaining estimate as my planning estimate for my board, I noticed that it will display remaining hours only when the top-level ticket (be it story, bugs, etc) contains an original estimate. It does not display remaining hours when the top-level ticket does not have original estimate, but has sub-tasks that contains original estimates. This is hard for us to understand the total effort by just looking at the planning board.

Also, on the board, it only shows the top-level ticket hours, and does not include all the sub-tasks' hour.
fields.summary: Top-Level Tasks Does Not Display and/or Include Estimate Even if it Contains Sub-Tasks with Estimated Effort
